definitions.definition: The worth of something; value.
The proportional relationship between one amount, value etc. and another.
definitions.example: At the height of his powers, he was producing pictures at the rate of four a year.

definitions.definition: Speed.
definitions.example: The car was speeding down here at a hell of a rate.

definitions.definition: The relative speed of change or progress.
definitions.example: The rate of production at the factory is skyrocketing.

definitions.definition: The price of (an individual) thing; cost.
definitions.example: He asked quite a rate to take me to the airport.

definitions.definition: A set price or charge for all examples of a given case, commodity, service etc.
A wage calculated in relation to a unit of time.
definitions.example: We pay an hourly rate of between $10 – $15 per hour depending on qualifications and experience.

definitions.definition: Any of various taxes, especially those levied by a local authority.
definitions.example: I hardly have enough left every month to pay the rates.

definitions.definition: A class into which ships were assigned based on condition, size etc.; by extension, rank.
Established portion or measure; fixed allowance; ration.
Order; arrangement.
Ratification; approval.
The gain or loss of a timepiece in a unit of time.
To assign or be assigned a particular rank or level.
definitions.example: She is rated fourth in the country.

definitions.definition: To evaluate or estimate the value of.
To consider or regard.
To deserve; to be worth.
definitions.example: The view here hardly rates a mention in the travel guide.

definitions.definition: To determine the limits of safe functioning for a machine or electrical device.
definitions.example: The transformer is rated at 10 watts.

definitions.definition: To evaluate a property's value for the purposes of local taxation.
To like; to think highly of.
definitions.example: The customers don't rate the new burgers.

definitions.definition: To have position (in a certain class).
definitions.example: He rates as the best cyclist in the country.

definitions.definition: To have value or standing.
definitions.example: This last performance of hers didn't rate very high with the judges.

definitions.definition: To ratify.
To ascertain the exact rate of the gain or loss of (a chronometer) as compared with true time.
To berate, scold.
